intro: Lachnaea pedicellata, commonly known as the purple thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny, purple-tinted leaves and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Lachnaea pedicellata typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in meadows and along coastal areas. Its botanical features make it an important plant for both ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
